definitions.definition: (the art of making) a drawing or written or spoken description of someone that usually makes them look silly by making part of their appearance or character more noticeable than it really is:
examples: The characters in his early novels are a lot subtler than the overblown caricatures in his more recent work.
Charles Dickens caricatured lawyers (= represented them in a way that made them look silly) in several of his novels.
